title: Voice in the Static
description: A distress call from the Dictator's Vargr chauffeur. She's injured and her parents are stranded. The Travellers must choose what to do.

the_call.initial_contact: This is... this is the Dictator's chauffeur. My vehicle crashed. I can't see - glass in my eyes. Please, someone, my parents are still out there. They're elderly, they can't...
the_call.if_asked_location: I was heading to the ridge settlement. My parents... they didn't evacuate. Please, they're just three kilometers from the lava flow.
the_call.if_asked_about_help: Masterton sent everything to Barvinn. Eleven people there. He said... he said resources had to be prioritized. But my parents...
the_call.emotional_peak: They're good people. They never asked for anything. Please. I know we're Vargr, I know that means something here, but please...

ship.priority: Highndry could be trapped if ash accumulates
ship.risk: Delay might mean losing the ship

decision_factors: Three lives vs eleven (if resources are truly limited)
Species dynamics (would humans receive more help?)
What kind of people are the Travellers?

decline_rescue.consequence: Parents likely perish, chauffeur survives but devastated

creative_solution.note: Players may find ways to help both - reward creativity

no_roll_required: This is a choice, not a skill check. The drama is in the decision.

roleplay_guidance.chauffeur_voice: Desperate but not hysterical. A professional who has always done her job.
roleplay_guidance.weight_of_choice: Don't rush this. Let players feel the moral weight.
roleplay_guidance.no_right_answer: Both choices have costs. That's the point.
